courses.title: Power System Control and Operation
courses.description: Introduction to methods for the real time operation and control of power systems; to study the hardware and software technologies of modern energy management systems. Credit will not be awarded for both ECEP 6301 and ECE 6320.

courses.title: Power Systems Economics
courses.description: Comprehensive introduction to electricity economics, including economic theory, markets, and policy. Renewable energy, information systems, smart grid, and consumers examined as drivers for market architecture.

courses.title: Power System Planning & Reliability
courses.description: To introduce basic concepts as well as analysis and optimization techniques underlying reliability assessment of electric power systems and planning techniques. Credit not awarded for both ECEP 6305 and ECE 6322.

courses.title: Capstone Project
courses.description: Apply methods and techniques learned throughout the program to conduct energy system design. Students prepare a project proposal leading to a final report and presentation.

courses.title: Power System Protection
courses.description: The theory and practice of modern power system protection techniques. Credit will not be awarded for both ECEP 6351 and ECE 6323.
